content.raw: it should be easy. Drop me an issue in the release-tools tracker.
content.html: it should be easy. Drop me an issue in the release-tools tracker.

update.description:
This pull request creates a new executable on Windows `optitrackBridge` that uses NPTrackingTools.dll for getting the tracking information. Then, it sends the information over the network. I'm using the same multicast group and port than Motive but I created a new frameID.

The code is reused on Linux for unpacking the data coming from the "bridge" and for testing purposes.

On the Gazebo side, we can receive the tracking information from Motive or from the optritrackBridge.

I also fixed the compilation of the examples.
update.title: Optitrackbridge

content.raw: @_jrivero_ , how hard is to use Jenkins to generate the zip file with the optitrackBridge.exe and a few DLLs?
content.html: @jrivero , how hard is to use Jenkins to generate the zip file with the optitrackBridge.exe and a few DLLs?

content.raw: I tweaked the text in addb95a. This is copied from ignition-transport where the things are more complicated. I think we are fine here.
content.html: I tweaked the text in addb95a. This is copied from ignition-transport where the things are more complicated. I think we are fine here.

content.raw: Sounds good; keep me updated on that in case I need to update the Optitrack tutorial.
content.html: Sounds good; keep me updated on that in case I need to update the Optitrack tutorial.

content.raw: The idea is to ship a directory with the optitrackBridge.exe and some DLL libraries. We could upload a .zip to the S3 bucket and have a link available in one of the tutorials maybe.
content.html: The idea is to ship a directory with the optitrackBridge.exe and some DLL libraries. We could upload a .zip to the S3 bucket and have a link available in one of the tutorials maybe.

update.description:
This pull request creates a new executable on Windows `optitrackBridge` that uses NPTrackingTools.dll for getting the tracking information. Then, it sends the information over the network. I'm using the same multicast group and port than Motive but I created a new frameID.

The code is reused on Linux for unpacking the data coming from the "bridge" and for testing purposes.

update.title: Optitrackbridge

content.raw: Are we just going to copy the .exe into the VMs that get shipped with handsim? Maybe we should also distribute it to teams somehow in case they want to run TrackingTools on their own computer?
content.html: Are we just going to copy the .exe into the VMs that get shipped with handsim? Maybe we should also distribute it to teams somehow in case they want to run TrackingTools on their own computer?

content.raw: Yes, it's cross-platform and you can run it on Linux. It will not use the NPTrackingTools.dll, instead it generates some fake data for testing purposes.
content.html: Yes, it's cross-platform and you can run it on Linux. It will not use the NPTrackingTools.dll, instead it generates some fake data for testing purposes.

content.raw: Just a question, not a suggestion to change anything: this program is written to be cross-platform, but you expect it to only run on Windows, right?
content.html: Just a question, not a suggestion to change anything: this program is written to be cross-platform, but you expect it to only run on Windows, right?
